intro: Wahlenbergia neorigida, commonly known as the Mountain Forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, bell-shaped blooms. Wahlenbergia neorigida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
